sub_topic: Finding the volume of a sphere inscribed in a cube.
message_1: A cube with edge length 6 cm has a sphere inscribed in it. What is the volume of the sphere?
message_2:
To find the volume of the inscribed sphere, we first need to determine its radius. Since the sphere is inscribed in the cube, it touches all six faces of the cube. The diameter of the sphere is equal to the edge length of the cube.

The edge length of the cube is 6 cm, so the diameter of the sphere is also 6 cm. The radius of the sphere is half of the diameter, which is 3 cm.

The formula for the volume of a sphere is V = (4/3)πr^3, where V is the volume and r is the radius.

Substitute the radius into the formula:

V = (4/3)π(3 cm)^3
V = (4/3)π(27 cm^3)
V = (4π)(9 cm^3)
V = 36π cm^3

The volume of the inscribed sphere is approximately 36π cubic centimeters or approximately 113.097 cubic centimeters.
